CIC CDL Prod O

CCO Carrier of Small Arms Ammunition Job Aid

 

Remember to always carry your written authorization from your CO and this certificate of training when transporting ammunition.

 

Packing and loading ammunition:

•      Keep ammunition in its original container, or a marked, solid container with a lid

•      Each container must weigh 30kg or less

•      Secure ammunition in a clean cargo space, not in passenger compartment

•      Don’t transport ammunition alongside other dangerous goods

 

Action in case of an emergency:

Accident: In the case of a vehicle accident, inform emergency services of the presence of ammunition in the vehicle when they arrive. Place any available warning cones or triangles around the vehicle. Contact your Commanding Officer and/or chain of command so they can arrange for a replacement vehicle and driver – if required.

 

Fire: Ammunition can explode from being in a fire however the risk of being injured by projectiles is low. Demonstrate due diligence by maintaining a safe distance from the vehicle (minimum 10m), keeping bystanders back, and re-routing other vehicles away from a burning vehicle. Do not attempt to remove the ammunition from a burning vehicle.

 

Towing: Remove the ammunition from the vehicle before it is towed.
